medical_history.chief_complaint: Weight loss, hematuria, hemoptysis, weakness, and a rash.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until three years earlier, when he began experiencing shortness of breath, wheezing, and cough after moving into a new home with mold infestation. Symptoms persisted despite environmental interventions and evaluations by specialists. Over eight months before admission, he lost approximately 20 kg due to decreased appetite. Episodes of hematuria occurred in the month preceding admission, along with recent development of skin lesions and worsening weakness, culminating in reddish, blood-tinged sputum two days before admission.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a licensed practical nurse and lay minister, had worked in maintenance and painting, lived with his wife and daughter, had never smoked or used illicit drugs, and did not consume alcohol.
